Detailed Description

Class to handle the management of the builtin functions which are part of the standard library. In order to allow other parts of the front-end to work with them without needing to special case their usage we generate function declarations to add to the symbol table, destroying them at the end of the program.

Member Function Documentation

void CBuiltinFuncMngr::InitialiseBuiltins ( bool  InMir  ) 

Create the builtin function decls for use later on if required.

Parameters:
InMir True if the builtins are being created for use in the MIR representation where all function names are prepended with a leading underscore.

void CBuiltinFuncMngr::DestroyBuiltins ( void   ) 

Destroy any builtin functions created by InitialiseBuiltins.

bool CBuiltinFuncMngr::IsBuiltinFunction ( const string &  FuncName  ) 

Check whether an identifer refers to a built in function.

Parameters:
FuncName Name of the function to check.
Returns:
True if FuncName refers to a built in function otherwise false.

Field Documentation

vector<string> CBuiltinFuncMngr::m_BuiltinFuncs [private]

List of builtin functions keyed by their name. The value part of the map is the parameter type the function expects to enable type checking to take place.

vector<CTreeNode*> CBuiltinFuncMngr::m_BuiltinFnDecls [private]

Function decls for each builtin function, keyed by their name.
